revised_title: Nitric Oxide Formation in High-Pressure Flames of Carbonic Oxide
tldr: This article investigates the formation of nitric oxide in high-pressure flames of carbonic oxide in oxygen-nitrogen atmospheres. The authors found that increasing pressure promotes nitric oxide formation and that the nitric oxide to carbon dioxide ratios in the exit gases increase with the nitrogen to carbon dioxide ratio, even past the theoretical 0.5 oxygen to carbon monoxide ratio. The results show that nitric oxide formation is influenced by both thermal factors and "ionization" in the flame.
